channel.title: Adding NPCs to WinterLove
channel.description: Hi, just wondering how I can add NPCs to WinterLove. The only NPCs that are in the source folder/files are the ones from the fight caves but I don't have the java file to have a look inside them. Should I use a different source and client or just stick with WinterLove? And if I do use a different client and source if suggested, what one should I use?

item.title: Adding NPCs to WinterLove
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

EJ:

So… the animations are all in there too or something? How would I know how to solve a stretch glitch or something?

No. The only values in the spawn config are the ones related to position/id/walking.

To change animations they’re in the actual code… probably somewhere in the npc handling. I don’t exactly use delta (I stopped using it in like 2010…), so I don’t recall the exact place for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding NPCs to WinterLove
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

EJ:

Found a folder of .cfg files, how do I add/edit NPCs though?

Right click > Edit
Open in notepad.
make changes.
save.
restart server.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding NPCs to WinterLove
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

EJ:

Hi, just wondering how I can add NPCs to WinterLove. The only NPCs that are in the source folder/files are the ones from the fight caves but I don’t have the java file to have a look inside them. Should I use a different source and client or just stick with WinterLove? And if I do use a different client and source if suggested, what one should I use?

They use a .cfg file to spawn npcs.
Look for “npc-spawns.cfg” or something of that variation.

Read full topic
